intro: Odontites bolligeri, commonly known as the Bolliger's toothed grass, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine regions. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to the cold, harsh conditions of its native habitat. Odontites bolligeri is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in mountain ecosystems.
